item.title: Git Add Commit Push
item.description: Updating the contents of a site after it has been deployed: Steps: clone the git repository username.github.io change files or create files add the changes to the repository using git add filename commit these changes using git commit -m "commit message" push these changes using git push recording for after the repository has been cloned and changes have been made: https://asciinema.org/a/1spEiDMcqwEN6pZZWieqiRMRv

item.title: Installing Hugo, Trial and Error
item.description: It took me three attempts to successfully install Hugo. I realised the consequence of not reading the doccumentation and instructions properly. First Attempt I used the apt-get command line tool to install hugo. sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install hugo I went on to explore the themes and and I came across this: *Minimum Hugo Version: 0.82.0 On checking: hugo version Hugo Static Site Generator v0.40.1 linux/amd64 BuildDate:2018-04-25T17:16:11Z I found that this is the default version the apt-get tool installs

item.title: Asciinema
item.description: Asciinema is a command line based terminal recording session. It records all the output on the terminal. The recording can be saved locally or on an asciinema account. How to install asciinema CLICK to view recording Linking your terminal to your asciinema account: The asciinema auth command (as shown in image) generates a link, linking your account to the terminal. Recording a terminal session The asciinema rec command (as shown in image) starts recording a terminal session.

item.title: Creating a site using github pages
item.description: I followed these instructions to create a site using pages. Steps followed: created a github account created a repository cloned the repository created an index.md file with the initial message “hello world this file can be edited later from the github site) added this file to the repository commited it pushed in on the main branch Terminal recording of how I did this Since the page had to be written in markdown, I used the markdown cheat sheet as reference.
